page.title: 04A Farm in Blakesley.
page.content: The farm is about 250acres in size and is split up into approximately 170acres of arable land and 80acres of grassland.It is a family run farm with all of the farming members being partners in the business.In Autumn, we are busy making the silage to feed to the animals in the winter.To make the silage we mow the grass one day and then the following day the grass is baled up into large round bales. The bal are then put into polythene bags, sealed up and left until required.After the first cut of grass for silage there will then be a break of a few weeks during which time we prepare everything for the start of harvest.
